intro: Sida pterosperma, commonly known as the silky sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Asia, including India, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale green leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round, black seeds. Sida pterosperma is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
